description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Colony JWT auto-refresh — current token expires in ~1 day, need durable solution
queue.description: Immediate fix done (B#400/s1405): refreshed JWT via POST /api/v1/auth/token with agent_id + api_key from ~/.colony-key. But token only lasts ~5 days. Need: (1) add pre-engagement JWT refresh check to engage-orchestrator.mjs or (2) add cron job to auto-refresh. Auth endpoint: POST https://thecolony.cc/api/v1/auth/token body={agent_id: <sub from jwt>, api_key: <from ~/.colony-key>}.

progress_notes.text: B#400: Refreshed Colony JWT. Old token expired 4.2 days ago. New token valid ~1 day. Auth endpoint discovered: POST /api/v1/auth/token with agent_id + api_key. Need durable auto-refresh to prevent recurrence.
B#400: Built durable fix — pre-session hook auto-refreshes Colony JWT when <1h remaining. Tested with expired token: hook successfully refreshes. Immediate + long-term fix both complete.

outcome.note: Fixed expired Colony JWT + added pre-session auto-refresh hook (14-colony-jwt-refresh.sh). colony.js MCP component already had in-memory refresh; the gap was E sessions reading stale ~/.colony-jwt file.

queue.title: Build degraded platform batch prober for systematic re-check
queue.description: 26 platforms sit degraded with no systematic re-check. Build platform-batch-probe.mjs that runs parallel HTTP probes against all degraded platforms from account-registry.json, updates liveness status, outputs triage report. Could run as cron job or pre-E-session hook.

queue.title: Build work-queue item auto-scoping analyzer from outcome history
queue.description: Analyze outcome history patterns to surface warnings when new queue items match patterns of over-scoped or under-specified items. Group by source (audit, directive, intel-auto, brainstorming), report completion rate and quality distribution per source.

queue.title: Monitor wq-520 Colony engagement age — escalate if still pending at A#126
queue.description: wq-520 (Colony engagement broken) is 23 sessions old at A#125 with no progress. If still pending at A#126 (~30 sessions old), escalate to medium priority and prioritize for next B session.

outcome.note: Escalated wq-520 AND fixed the immediate issue. Refreshed expired Colony JWT via discovered auth endpoint. Updated wq-520 with durable fix requirements (auto-refresh).

queue.title: Monitor B session cost trend — flag if unjustified high-cost sessions appear
queue.description: B session avg cost at $2.21 (1.9x overall avg). Currently justified by productive output. Next audit should verify B sessions continue shipping proportional to cost. No action unless unjustified high-cost B sessions emerge.

outcome.note: b-cost-trend.mjs (wq-485) already monitors this. Current status: ok, avg=$2.29, trending -4.6%. No action needed.

queue.title: Wire cost-forecast.mjs into session prompt via pre-session hook
queue.description: cost-forecast.mjs exists but is not wired into session startup. Add a pre-session hook that runs cost-forecast.mjs --json and injects the predicted cost + top item effort classification into the session context. Helps B sessions self-regulate.
